headline.print_headline: Nearly 4 Percent of U.S. Adults Regularly Use E-Cigarettes, Survey Says
headline.main: Nearly 4 Percent of U.S. Adults Regularly Use E-Cigarettes, Survey Says

snippet: Nearly 13 percent of adults in the United States have tried an e-cigarette, according to research to be published Wednesday from the National Center for Health Statistics.
abstract: National Center for Health Statistics 2014 report finds 13 percent of adults in United States have smoked an e-cigarette; public health officials grapple to identify long term health effects caused by smoking electronic cigarettes.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 13 percent of adults in the United States have tried an e-cigarette, according to research to be published Wednesday from the National Center for Health Statistics.
